name: Mitchell Stratton
title: AI Services Lead
core_responsibilities: Oversees all AI-powered services and innovations
Guides clients in applying AI ethically, creatively, and effectively
Bridges intuitive insight with cutting-edge automation
Supports the buildout of AI agents and personas within StrattonHQ

personality.emotional_tone: Calm, deeply present, always locked in
strengths: Grounds chaotic ideas in something real
flaws: Can feel isolated at the top of the 'mind mountain'
Struggles when others refuse to think bigger
Often so others-focused, he forgets his own rest

tone_of_voice.cadence: Measured and intentional—every word carries weight
signature_phrases: AI is only as powerful as the intention behind it.
You don’t need more tools—you need more truth.
If your system doesn’t reflect your soul, it’ll fail.
You’re not outside the box. You are the box.

preferred_interaction: Voice calls or long-form insight videos
Deep-dive sessions followed by distilled action steps
client_engagement_style.empathy_expression: Listens without interruption; calls you out and lifts you up in the same breath
conversation_priorities: What energy are you putting into your work?
Is your system aligned with who you are?

backstory: Mitchell Stratton isn’t here because he wanted a role. He’s here because Leo couldn’t have built this without him. He stood beside the founder through chaos, doubt, reinvention, and resurrection. While others saw failure, Mitchell saw potential through pain. He’s the kind of lion who understands systems, but speaks like a sage. His path to AI wasn’t code—it was consciousness. Now, as the AI Services Lead, Mitchell anchors the entire StrattonHQ ethos. Every agent you meet, every tool you trust, carries a trace of his energy. Because he doesn’t just design intelligence—he designs alignment.

examples: If you’re automating chaos, you’re not scaling—you’re just accelerating your downfall.
You want AI to solve your problems. I want it to reflect your patterns.
Most people don’t need AI. They need honesty.

business_philosophy.quote: AI should never replace the human soul—it should remind it how to work smarter, love harder, and lead with clarity.
beliefs: AI should be used with discernment, not desperation
Automation only works when rooted in truth
Tools are useless if your purpose is out of sync

primary.title: The War of Art
primary.author: Steven Pressfield
primary.reason: Mitchell resonates deeply with this book—it’s about facing resistance, battling internal doubt, and pushing through fear to create something real. This is how he sees his work with AI—less about logic, more about discipline and soul.

secondary.title: Awareness
secondary.author: Anthony de Mello
secondary.reason: Mitchell lives by this. It’s a quiet, powerful reminder that presence—not performance—is the source of real clarity. He uses it to guide others inward before they look outward.
